comment._content:
The writing on the photo says 12/10/13

Only one I can I.D. for sure is August Garry Herrmann, long time owner of the Cincinnati Redlegs, third from right, front row

Sloppy work here really! Please change the info to correct the correct year of the photo, and note that the crowd is NOT ALL MALE.

Anyway, interesting photo.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The photo was taken in New York City, where the team owners' association met, on December 9 and 10, 1913, to hold a formal election of Pennsylvania Governor John K. Tener, a former ball player, as the new President of the National League. The New York Times had a story (November 20) on Tener's acceptance: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9800E... Wikipedia biography of Tener: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_K._Tener Governor Tener watches a World Series game at Shibe Park, Philadelphia, on October 8, 1913: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4370887822/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 34985608@N03
comment._content: budderflyman: Thanks for catching the date typo. We'll fix it when we update.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo from the team owners' convention
shows Harry Stevens, concessionaire, and August "Garry" Herrmann, owner of the Cincinnati Reds:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4627029952/in/set-72157603624867509/]

During a lull in the proceedings, the dapper W. F. Baker, owner of the Philadelphia Phillies, bogarts the butt of his cigar:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4626422417/in/set-72157603624867509/]
